headline: Gold's Decline Seen as Healthy Correction After 'Irrational' Rally
summary: Gold's recent pullback is a healthy technical correction following an "irrational" rally seen in previous days, said Yuxuan Tang of J.P. Morgan Private Bank.  Tang said that Kevin Warsh's nomination as Federal Reserve chair doesn't alter a broadly supportive policy backdrop for gold, while the longer-term erosion of global fiscal discipline is also unlikely to reverse.  J.P. Morgan Private Bank raises its year-end gold target to $6,150 a troy ounce, with a forecast range of $6,000 to $6,300, noting that investor positioning remains far from crowded.

raw.headline: Gold's Decline Seen as Healthy Correction After 'Irrational' Rally
raw.summary: Gold's recent pullback is a healthy technical correction following an "irrational" rally seen in previous days, said Yuxuan Tang of J.P. Morgan Private Bank.  Tang said that Kevin Warsh's nomination as Federal Reserve chair doesn't alter a broadly supportive policy backdrop for gold, while the longer-term erosion of global fiscal discipline is also unlikely to reverse.  J.P. Morgan Private Bank raises its year-end gold target to $6,150 a troy ounce, with a forecast range of $6,000 to $6,300, noting that investor positioning remains far from crowded.

headline: Trump Lawsuit And Crypto Clash Put JPMorgan’s Regulatory Risks In Focus
summary: President Trump has filed a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase and CEO Jamie Dimon alleging politically motivated account closures and biased debanking practices. The case has triggered wider scrutiny of how large banks handle account terminations and political or reputational risk. At Davos, Jamie Dimon publicly clashed with Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong over stablecoin rewards and the role of crypto platforms in competing for customer funds. JPMorgan Chase (ticker NYSE:JPM) is one of the...

summary: Trump lawsuit puts JPMorgan Chase (JPM) in the political spotlight President Trump’s new lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase (JPM) and CEO Jamie Dimon over allegedly political account closures has pushed the bank into a rare mix of legal, regulatory, and election year scrutiny. headline: Jamie Dimon Reportedly Blasted Brian Armstrong In Davos: 'You Are Full Of...'
summary: Coinbase Global Inc. (NASDAQ:COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong reportedly faced harsh criticism from Wall Street’s biggest bank chiefs at the World Economic Forum in Davos. The Davos Showdown JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon interrupted Armstrong’s coffee meeting with former U.K. Prime Minister Tony Blair to confront him directly according to a Wall Street Journal feature published on Friday. “You are full of s—,” Dimon said with his index finger pointed at Armstrong’s face, telling him to stop
